      "source": [
        "#how do I found the elements that are below a given threshold?\n",
        "\n",
        "import numpy as np\n",
        "from matplotlib import pyplot as plt\n",
        "\n",
        "x = np.random.randn(10000,1)\n",
        "\n",
        "th = 0.8\n",
        "\n",
        "z = x <= th\n",
        "x.ravel()\n",
        "\n",
        "prob_z = np.mean(z)\n",
        "\n",
        "print(prob_z)\n",
        "th_values = np.linspace(0, 1, 100, endpoint=True)\n",
        "print(th_values.shape)\n",
        "\n",
        "prob_z = np.zeros(shape=th_values.shape)\n",
        "print(prob_z)\n",
        "\n",
        "for i, th in enumerate(th_values):\n",
        "    prob_z[i] = (x <= th).mean()\n",
        "\n",
        "plt.plot(th_values, prob_z)\n",
        "plt.show()\n",
        "\n",
        "print(\"It's not working well, just check\")"
      ],

      },
      "source": [
        "import numpy as np\n",
        "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
        "\n",
        "x = mnist.data / 255\n",
        "y = np.array(mnist.target, dtype=int)\n",
        "\n",
        "print(x.shape, y.shape)\n",
        "\n",
        "#print(y[0:10])\n",
        "\n",
        "#extraxt my first images\n",
        "img = x[0, :].reshape(28,28) #we use'reshape' to order in a 28x28 matrix\n",
        "print(img.shape)\n",
        "\n",
        "plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))\n",
        "for i in range(10):\n",
        "  plt.subplot(2,5,i+1)\n",
        "  img = x[i, :].reshape(28,28)\n",
        "  plt.imshow(img, cmap='gray')\n",
        "  plt.title(\"Label: \" + str(y[i]))\n",
        "\n"
      ],
      "execution_count": 28,
      "outputs": [

          "output_type": "stream",

    {
      "cell_type": "code",

        "outputId": "09c21f65-7a41-4646-e8e1-c2ca880e0bdc"
      },
      "source": [
        "class_labels = np.unique(y)\n",
        "n_classes = class_labels.size\n",
        "print(n_classes)\n",
        "print(\" \")\n",
        "\n",
        "#count how many elements we have in each class\n",
        "n_samples_per_class = np.zeros(shape=(n_classes,))\n",
        "#print(n_samples_per_class)\n",
        "\n",
        "#how many digits of class 'k' do we have among the 70k given images?\n",
        "for k in range(n_classes):\n",
        "    n_samples_per_class[k] = np.sum(y == k) #it count how many true we have\n",
        "\n",
        "print(n_samples_per_class)\n",
        "print(\" \")\n",
        "print(n_samples_per_class.sum())\n",
        "\n",
        "print(class_labels)\n",
        "plt.bar(class_labels, n_samples_per_class)"
      ],
